snippet: A recent appeals court decision may result in a test of whether the S.E.C. can win an insider trading verdict by putting on a circumstantial case built around a well-timed trade and contacts with an insider.
abstract: A recent appeals court decision may result in a test of whether the S.E.C. can win an insider trading verdict by putting on a circumstantial case built around a well-timed trade and contacts with an insider.

headline.main: Can the S.E.C. Win an Insider Case the Old-Fashioned Way?
